title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
03:52 <altker128> Hey all, anyone here?  
03:55 <altker128> I'm trying to figure out why xwiki sometimes throws up an entire info box around something that seems like it has a start/stop.  Maybe it's because some things are being escaped in the body of my text?  
03:56 <altker128> This is the wiki content: http://pastebin.com/j7eemn7H  
03:56 <altker128> And line #54 is what I'm struggling with: {{info}}Hi, this is info box{{//info}}  
03:58 <altker128> ok...it's the //  
03:58 <altker128> sorry  
07:51 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <msmeria> good morning  
09:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <vmassol> good morning  
09:00 <msmeria> tmortagne: when I install the UI with the xar on the latest 5.1-snap XEM I get http://hastebin.com/hexefeyufo.sm in the console and this key "workspacemanager.template.install.notYetComplete" on the homepage instead of the link to install the workspace template  
09:03 <tmortagne> msmeria: you get untranslated content because of errors like "Access denied when checking  access to [Wiki xwiki] for user [xwiki:XWiki.Admin]" (which mean the corresponding translations are not regsitered) but I don't understand why this user does not have admin right  
09:04 <tmortagne> i.e. the root of your issues is that for some reason Admin user does not have admin right...  
09:04 <msmeria> that's weird. even with superadmin I still see that key  
09:07 <msmeria> tmortagne: I restarted the wiki and now I don't see the key anymore  
09:07 <msmeria> I get the proper text and link  
09:08 <tmortagne> msmeria: what do you mean by "even with superadmin" ?  
09:08 <msmeria> I mean I logged out of the Admin user and logged in with superadmin  
09:08 <msmeria> I still got the key then  
09:08 <tmortagne> of course  
09:08 <tmortagne> this has nothing to do with the current user  
09:09 <tmortagne> the right check is done when the document is saved to see if the document author has to right to do what he wants to do (regsiter en translation document for the whole wiki)  
09:09 <tmortagne> s/to/the/  
09:10 <tmortagne> when you restart the check is done again  
09:10 <tmortagne> and for some reason this time it works (as it should)  
09:11 <tmortagne> what I don't understand is why suddenly it does not work anymore during install  
09:11 <tmortagne> it's the first time I see this  
09:11 <msmeria> me too  
09:11 <npm> has quit  
09:11 <tmortagne> what did you do exactly ?  
09:13 <msmeria> I set up xwiki with jetty. enabled superadmin in xwiki.cfg .cancel on the dw. logged in as superadmin and installed the UI. logged-out with superadmin and logged-in as Admin. go to the homepage  
09:13 <msmeria> I used hsqldb  
09:14 <tmortagne> msmeria: wait you did not used DW ?  
09:15 <tmortagne> so that's probably why  
09:16 <tmortagne> there is nothing forcing admin user to be installed first in the all in one xar so all stuff based on document author right have this kind of issue  
09:16 <msmeria> it didn't happen before though  
09:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <tmortagne> it did  
09:16 <tmortagne> that's for sure  
09:16 <tmortagne> and with various other feature like translations  
09:16 <msmeria> ok then since I got hired I don't remember seeing the translation :)  
09:17 <tmortagne> we still have a general order issue when the author of the document is imported with the documents  
09:17 <tmortagne> msmeria: you should not have the isue if you don't import as backup pack  
09:17 <tmortagne> in that case document will be imported as superadmin so no right issue  
09:18 <tmortagne> anyway in general importing as backup pack should be only well for backups  
09:18 <tmortagne> so you should never use that for installing an application  
09:18 <tmortagne> a pity it's on by default  
09:19 <tmortagne> but since DW import is supposed to be more and more for backup and not installing extensions  
09:20 <msmeria> tmortagne: I'll try again without selecting backup  
09:22 <vmassol> guys we need to release today, what are we missing to start the release?  
09:23 <vmassol> (marius is finishing an improvement and then we're good I think)  
09:24 <msmeria> tmortagne: I can confirm the bug doesn't happen if I deselect the backup checkbox  
09:31 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <tmortagne> msmeria: ok so that's it, I think there is a jira issue about that  
09:36 <tmortagne> but it's not an easy fix, will require quite some refactoring of how we handle event produced by import. But now that you have to already be admin to import a XAR it's less an issue that it used to be (when you were importing as guest)  
09:38 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <kstuart> has quit  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <altker128> Is it possible to turn off formatting inside macros , like box or info ?  
11:18 <vmassol> altker128: sure, just escape the content  
11:18 <vmassol> {{{…}}}  
11:18 <vmassol> :)  
11:18 <altker128> That's smart :)  
11:18 <altker128> Is there a way to indent the box as well?  
11:19 <vmassol> indent?  
11:19 <vmassol> that looks like CSS no?  
11:19 <vmassol> (% style="…" %){{box …  
{{/irclog}}  
11:19 <vmassol> (either that or using a stylesheet extension)  
11:20 <altker128> I mean, if I have bullets, I want the box to be at the same "tab stop" as a bullet  
11:20 <vmassol> use groups (((….)))  
11:20 <vmassol> \* item 1(((  
11:21 <vmassol> {{box...}}  
11:21 <vmassol> )))  
11:21 <vmassol> \* item 2

12:34 <gdelhumeau> I have to go for lunch, be back in 1h~1h30

12:51 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:01 <sburjan> hello devs. I am playing with the search on a XEM. I found out that the page XWikiComments is hidden on the main wiki, but not hidden in the template nor in the wikis created from the template. Is this known >  
13:01 <sburjan> ?  
13:02 <sburjan> also, it does not have the ClassSheetBinding object on it  
13:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <mflorea> has quit

15:20 <vmassol1> hmmm I think there's a bug/regression  
15:21 <vmassol1> ah no  
15:21 <vmassol1> my bad  
15:21 <vmassol1> :)  
15:38 <sburjan> hello devs. I am playing with the search on a XEM. I found out that the page "XWikiComments" is hidden on the main wiki, but not hidden in the template nor in the wikis created from the template. Is this known/intended ? Also, it does not contain the ClassSheetBinding.

20:36 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:41 <sdumitriu1> vmassol1: She's already listed as a committer  
20:41 <vmassol1> I know  
20:41 <vmassol1> but that doesn't represent what she does  
20:41 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
20:42 <sdumitriu1> But a "committer" is not someone that commits code  
20:42 <vmassol> she's both a committer AND a designer/usability expert/mockup specialist, her committer role is minor by comparison with her design role  
20:42 <sdumitriu1> They're the "driving force behind XWiki"  
20:42 <vmassol> I'm modifying that page sergiu  
20:42 <sdumitriu1> K  
20:42 <vmassol> to use the github stats app  
20:42 <vmassol> and it'll show commit # too  
20:43 <vmassol> I just need to tune my app to better show organization since I don't make that too visible ATM  
20:43 <vmassol> and then I can apply it  
20:44 <vmassol> another solution would be to have a notion of roles in addition to committers  
20:44 <vmassol> role = developer | design | etc  
20:44 <vmassol> I'm not sure yet  
20:44 <vmassol> gtg  
20:44 <vmassol> bbl
